intro: Physocalymma scaberrimum, commonly known as the roughleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has rough, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Physocalymma scaberrimum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
